results.title: Metformin, resveratrol, and exendin-4 inhibit high phosphate-induced vascular calcification via AMPK-RANKL signaling.

results.title: Metformin ameliorates valve interstitial cell calcification by promoting autophagic flux
results.text_hl: It has previously been established that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration reduces @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Calcification</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D061205 @@@arterial calcification@@@ via autophagy; however, whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ directly regulates @DISEASE_109730 @DISEASE_OMIM:109730 @@@CAVD@@@ has yet to be elucidated.

results.title: AMPK: Potential Therapeutic Target for Vascular Calcification
results.text_hl: The @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_Calcification</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D061205 @@@VC@@@ progression in the coronary artery and peripheral artery was inhibited by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ usage.

results.title: Association between metformin use and below-the-knee arterial calcification score in type 2 diabetic patients

results.title: Metformin prevents the development of severe chronic kidney disease and its associated mineral and bone disorder.
